title: Understanding Wildcards in SQL
text: In SQL, a wildcard is a special character used to substitute for any other character(s) in a string. They are often used in search operations to filter data based on patterns.

title: Common SQL Wildcards
text:
The most common wildcards in SQL are:
- `%`: Represents zero or more characters.
- $$`_{}`$$: Represents a single character.
- `*`: Often used to select all columns in a table.

title: Using Wildcards to Select All Fields
text: To select all fields in a table, you use the wildcard that represents all columns. Which wildcard is it?
